item.title: A new idea for 'causal analysis of controlled experiments'
item.description: We designed a framework to conduct causal analysis of controlled experiments. In controlled experiments, we have controlled group (A) and experiment group (B). Usually, a certain change of variable (intervention) happed in group B. If the result shows a statistically significant difference between A and B, we say such intervention does matter. However, the intervention may cause good effects and bad effects for different people, which we have not known. Our goal is to find the subset of samples for which the intervention is effective.
